item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Browser security
item.description: 13. Browser Security Browser Security & Web Security Web browser: (client side) Attacks target browser security weaknesses Result in: Malware installation (keyloggers, bot-nets) Document theft from corporate network Loss of private data Web application code: (server side) Runs at web site: banks, e-merchants, blogs Written in PHP, ASP, JSP, Ruby, … Many potential bugs: XSS, XSRF, SQL injection Attacks lead to stolen CC#, defaced sites. 13.1 Web Basics HTTP(S) is

item.title: Network security
item.description: 11. Network Security 11.1 Intro Network security deals with secure communication over an insecure medium. Secure Communication properties Confidentiality Intergrity - message contents remain unaltered Authentication Availability Adversary types Eavesdropping attackers only listen; no inject(spoof), intercept or modify; how? use (remote) antenna Defense: encryption Man-in-the-middle attackers On-path; can listen, inject, block and change messages how? Control router/switch/link; route-hijacking Defense: encryption, signatures, MACs Off-path attackers Off-path (do not control devices on

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Web security
item.description: 12. Web Security 12.1 Intro Big trend => Software as a Web-based service Online banking, shopping, government, bill payment, tax prep, customer relationship management, etc. Cloud computing But, Security => poor Poorly written scripts with inadequate input validation Sensitive data stored in world-readable files Typical Web Application Written in a mixture of PHP, Java, JavaScript, Python, C, Go, … Runs on a Web server or Application Server Interacts with back-end

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: About
item.description: Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows. Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.
